tn.text: Here "I" refers to Yahweh.

tn.ref: I have spread out my hands all day to a stubborn people
tn.text: "Spreading out my hands" is a person's gesture to show imploring or a strong request. AT: "I have continually begged a stubborn people to receive my help." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Yahweh continues speaking about the people of Israel.

These refer to Canaanite places for worshiping idols. Their sacred altars were made of bricks, which Yahweh forbid for his altars. Yahweh's altars were made of stone. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: sit among the graves and keep watch all night
tn.text: This is a reference to consulting the dead, a practice that Yahweh prohibited. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Yahweh did not allow the people of Israel to eat meat from pigs. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Yahweh continues speaking to and about the people of Israel.

tn.ref: These things are smoke in my nose
tn.text: Yahweh compares these people who are continually annoying him to smoke that irritates a person's breathing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: a fire that burns all day long
tn.text: Yahweh compares the people of Israel to a slow-burning fire that sends out smoke without stopping as it irritates. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh continues speaking about the people of Israel.
"Take notice and pay attention"

This means God will punish them to the fullest extent. This expression compares Yahweh punishing the people to dumping on their legs as they are sitting. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: As when juice is found in a cluster of grapes
tn.text: Yahweh compares the people of Israel to a cluster of grapes that still has some good juice in it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: when juice is found in a cluster
tn.text: This can be stated in an active way. AT: "when you find juice in a cluster" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: I will not ruin them all
tn.text: This can be expressed positively. AT: "I will spare some of them who are righteous" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Yahweh continues speaking.
This refers to the highest locations of Jerusalem and all of Judea.
This was a fertile grazing area. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a valley that possibly ran from Jerusalem to south of Jericho. This was also a fertile grazing area. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Yahweh continues speaking.
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:11:08|11:9]].

tn.ref: who prepare a table ... and fill wine glasses of mingled wine
tn.text: People would bring food and drink and place it in front of the idol as part of their worship.
wine mixed with spices
These are names of false gods. They are also called "Gad" and "Meni."
Yahweh continues speaking to those in Israel who worship idols.
"The sword" represents weapons of war that Yahweh will use to punish those who do not respond to Yahweh's call. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: when I called, you did not answer; when I spoke, you did not listen
tn.text: Both clauses mean the same and are repeated for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Yahweh continues speaking to those in Israel who worship idols.
"Take notice and pay attention" Yahweh repeats this for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: but you will cry because of the pain of the heart, and will wail because of the crushing of the spirit
tn.text: These clauses mean the same and the repetition is for emphasis. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This expression compares the feeling of terrible disappointment and sorrow to something becoming deformed due to high pressure. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Yahweh continues speaking to those in Israel who worship idols.

tn.ref: will be blessed by me, the God of truth
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I, the God who always speaks the truth, will bless him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the former troubles will be forgotten ... will be hidden
tn.text: the former troubles will be forgotten ... will be hidden These clauses can be stated in active form. AT: "they will forget the former troubles, for these troubles will be out of my memory" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: they will be hidden from my eyes
tn.text: "hidden from my eyes" represents the attention and memory of Yahweh. AT: "I will not even think about them again" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
Yahweh continues speaking.
"Notice! Pay attention!"

tn.ref: new heavens and a new earth
tn.text: Both are extremes that also represent everything between. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])

tn.ref: the former things will not be remembered or be brought to mind
tn.text: Both of these clauses mean the same thing and are combined for emphasis. This can be stated in active form. AT: "you will not even think about what happened in the past" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "you" refers to all of God's servants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_youdual]])

tn.ref: weeping and cries of distress will no longer be heard in her
tn.text: You can state this in active form. AT: "no one will hear weeping and cries of distress any longer in her." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues speaking about his faithful people.
"100 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: will be considered a young person
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "people will consider him a young person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated this in active form. AT: "people will consider this person as cursed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues speaking about his faithful people.

tn.ref: for as the days of trees will be the days of my people
tn.text: "Days" refers to the span of their lifetime. AT: "for my people will live as long as trees live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: they are the children of those blessed by Yahweh
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they are the children of those whom Yahweh blessed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Yahweh continues speaking about his faithful people.
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:isa:11:08|11:9]].
